I know what the Worm "Cocoon" does and how to use the "Emerge" card!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): I know what the Worm "Cocoon" does and how to use the "Emerge" card!
By Eagle_Fierce on Thursday, August 24, 2000 - 09:02 am:

I've finally figured it out! Here's how to use the Worm's "Cocoon" and "Emergence" cards...

1.) Have Worm sub-type cards (ie. Night Flyer and Soboros) off to the side. DO NOT PUT THEM IN ANY DECK.

2.) Use "Cocoon" in battle.

3.) Use "Emerge" on the Worm that cocooned, and a list will pop up. Choose the Worm sub-type monster that you want from the list. This is why you have to leave your Worm sub-types out of ANY deck.

4.) The Worm breed will switch places with the chosen monster. For those of you that know Magic: The Gathering, think of it as side bording a monster for another that has the eqilavent sub-type of the main breed (Worm).

Uses: say that you're playing with a Soboros (why you would is beyond me, but still...)...You have a Worm, Hare, and Soboros. The Worm is gettign pounded, and you aren't ready for a K.O.! Use "Cocoon" and hold out on the Worm until next turn. Use "Emerge," and trade the Worm in for a brand-new Soboros that was lying in your list of extra cards. Now, you don't have a scratch on the monster, and you can still use the Worm defense.

It took me a while to learn this trick (about three straight days of trying), but it's somewhat very useful when you are up against a power hitting team like Rascal or Totti. Well, that's it for the Worm's "Cocoon" and "Emerge" cards. Happy ranching, everybody! ^_^
